description:
I don't have complicated requirements for a Mega Drive emulator: I want to play Sonic 3 & Knuckles using a PS3 gamepad. Blastem delivered! Its interface is functional, but spartan.

(There is some strange glitching across the bottom of the window – for me, this adds a bit of character.)
I can just play to any of my ol' games. Setting up all my keys was a little bit tedious, but once done, it's great.

summary: It doesn't work on my system

description:
1: I don't really like the UI. Just feels cheap.

2: You cannot change the settings while running a rom. You can do that in nearly every other emulator, but not this one.

3: There appears to be a layer on the bottom tenth of the emulated screen which has glitched pixels.

Gave it 3 stars since its the only one here and it does its job well enough, even if it's subpar most of the time.
summary: Does its job, but not that well. (At least for Genesis)

description: I've used Blastem in the past and it worked fine with unzeipped ROMs. When trying with 7zip compressed ROMs it doesn't list them in file selection. 4 stars because it does work well, but -1 star for not supporting 7zip.
Emulateur assez simple ,mais manque quelques options et optimisations et configurations des manettes pas très pratique.
